intro: Dalibarda cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in shaded environments. Dalibarda cordata is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
